section_info.title: Professional Experiences_XX
section_info.details: _XXA multidisciplinary professional background spanning over a decade across academic research, tertiary teaching, and industrial software development. This career trajectory is defined by a commitment to bridging the gap between theoretical Machine Learning and real-world applications within Healthcare and the Bio-sciences. Technical rigour and pedagogical expertise, established through the leadership of large-scale mobile application projects and doctoral research at Deakin University, drive innovation across diverse sectors.

expertise_list.title: Areas of Expertise_XX
areas_of_expertise: Application of AI, ML and DL
Applied Research in Health Informatics, Business Analytics, System Automation & Sustainable Environment

roles.title: Graduate Researcher (PhD Student)_XX
roles.about_job: Applied ML for sleep disorder detection using Hypnogram and find causalities using explainable AI.
description_list: Efficacy of sleep dynamics for sleep disorder detection
Analysis of age in sleep analysis
_XXImpact of noise in Hypnogram in sleep analysis

roles.title: Graduate Researcher (MRes Student)
roles.about_job: Applied ML project for EEG channel optimisation for epileptic seizure detection using EEG.

Factors influencing a real-world seizure detection system
EEG channel minimisation for seizure detection

roles.title: Research Assistant
roles.about_job: A collaborative applied ML project for epilepsy detection using EEG in clinical settings.
description_list: Research collaboration with Alfred hospital for real-world healthcare application
Epileptic seizure detection in critical setting of ICU
responsibilities_list: Research and collaboration with Monash University and Alfred Health in the initial design of a seizure detection system for ICU patients.
ML and DL model evaluation, testing, and visualisation.
Worked as an official (funded) employee from Aug 2021 to Dec 2021 and the rest of the period as a volunteer.
